function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Dissemination of unverified medical information and false news on social media can contribute to panic and misinformation.","Impact":"Increased social media platforms.","Technologies":"AI algorithms for detecting misinformation, content moderation tools, and user education initiatives.","People":"General public, vulnerable populations, and individuals seeking medical advice online.","Owner":"Social media platforms, government health agencies, and community organizations."},{"Description":"Social media platforms can be used to incite non-compliance with safety measures and guidelines.","Mitigation":"Enforcement of community guidelines, swift removal of misinformation, and public education campaigns to promote critical thinking and skepticism.","Technologies":"Content moderation tools, sentiment analysis algorithms, and public health information dissemination platforms.","People":"General public, online communities, and individuals seeking pandemic information.","Owner":"Social media platforms, government health agencies, and community organizations."},{"Description":"Mismanagement of crisis communication on social media can lead to ineffective dissemination of accurate information and exacerbate public fear and confusion.","Impact":"Ineffective communication leading to misunderstanding of health guidelines, trusted health authorities.","Technologies":"Communication management tools, real-time data analysis software, and crisis communication platforms.","People":"General public, online communities, and individuals seeking pandemic information.","Owner":"Social media platforms, government health agencies, and community organizations."}]}
